text: my Thanksgiving menu does not change
much from year to year but the one thing
I'm always looking for is a fresh
healthy delicious crunchy vibrant slaw
you cannot go wrong with this one it's
red cabbage and kale and julienned
carrots perfect addition to any
Thanksgiving table no matter what the
menu is
so let's get started on the dressing I'm
going to have a tablespoon of olive oil
with tablespoon of Dijon mustard this is
going to get that really nice acidic
bite and then a teaspoon of apple cider
vinegar and apple cider vinegar is
really interesting because it helps aid
in digestion which is great on
Thanksgiving when you sort of text your
entire system add a little salt and
pepper dressing is done let's finish up
with our chopped items we're looking for
about 3 cups of mixed kale and red
cabbage so I'm just using the curly kale
here could also use the dinosaur or
Tuscan kale and just thinly slice this
is another salad that I think tastes
even better the next day throw it on
your turkey sandwich you'll be super
excited looks great toss that to my bowl
and I think I'll probably do about half
of this head of red cabbage now red
cabbage and green cabbage you may think
are pretty similar but red cabbage has a
lot more nutrients than the green
cabbage so that's a really great healthy
swap okay that looks good toss this in
with the kale give it a good stir here
to that add 1/4 cup of picked parsley
leaves also really great for digestion
I'm going to leave just a few of these
behind for garnish and one large carrot
peeled and thinly julienned lots of
vitamin A vitamin C and a really really
satisfying crunch 2 tablespoons of
chopped red onion and now we come to our
seedy section 2 tablespoons sunflower
seeds again I'm just going to save a few
for garnish 2 tablespoons of hemp seeds
now hemp is a really great plant source
of omega-3 fatty acids it's also a
complete protein on par with quinoa so
vegetarians
is a great way to get good source of
protein two tablespoons of pumpkin seeds
now we're going to season and toss with
our dressing little salt lots of pepper
love the pepper and our dressing make
sure that this is very very well
tossed anytime I'm making a raw kale
salad you almost want to think of it as
massaging the dressing into the leaves
that not only helps flavor it but it
helps tenderize the leaves and make them
a little bit more tender
everything looks well mixed nice and
bright and glisteny transfer to a
platter just gorgeous talk about eating
the rainbow you have everything in here
now I can finish garnishing with our
leftover ingredients we'll add a little
bit of fresh parsley sunflower seeds
hemp seeds and our pumpkin seeds last
but not least this looks amazing
crunchy fresh CD this is exactly what
you want after a big meal like
Thanksgiving
